subject: HBO Options A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE
event:
Yes, it's true.  

Yes, this is the Big News that I have been hinting at.

No, the Big News was not the pizza crawl, or the delivery of the new WILD CARDS book, though of course I'm excited about those as well.

VARIETY broke the story this morning.  Instead of rehashing what they said, let me just point all of you toward:

http://www.variety.com/article/VR1117957532.html?categoryid=14&cs=1

I've already gotten close to a hundred emails this morning, just off the VARIETY article.  I expect that number will have swollen to several hundred before the day is out. I appreciate all the good wishes and congratulations, but I am NOT going to be able to respond to all of you individually.  

I will be making my own announcement on my news page, of course, and that may answer some of your questions, but I haven't actually written it yet, so please be patient.  

I appreciate all the casting suggestions too, but guys, you're getting way way WAY ahead of yourselves.  Developing a television series is a long and time-consuming process, and we're just getting started here.  We only closed the deal a couple of days ago.  

I will do my best to keep everyone informed as the project progresses, but this is not something you will be telling TIVO to record next week.

This might be a great time to subscribe to HBO, however.  Regardless of what happens with A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE, HBO still has the best shows on television, shows like DEADWOOD, THE WIRE, and THE SOPRANOS that stand head and shoulders above anything on the networks.  The second season of ROME just started last Sunday, and it's fabulous; the look of it, the writing, the directing, the acting, all of it is first rate.  That's why I have been saying for years that HBO was the perfect place for A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE.

comments.article: This will truely be an amazing chance to bring your incredible saga to the screen in the best way it deserves... way to make sure that it went down the way you had always wanted.  Can't wait!
comments.subject: Congrats!!

comments.article: In the immortal words of Austin Powers...Yeah baby!
comments.subject: In the immortal words of Austin Powers...Yeah baby!

comments.article: I'm Jewish but this is the best Christmas present ever.
I'm not really Jewish :(
There's a lot of questions, certainly, and a _lot_ of excitement. Definitely amazing news. :)
This is just fabulous news. Thank you for organizing this, I can't wait to see your impressive series come to HBO! Cheers.

Oh wow!

Is there going to be any chance of it coming over to England?

That is not the question to ask. The correct question is "can we make sure the channel that buys the rights understands not to cut it to damn ribbons and broadcast it in a kids slot".

Sorry. Will calm down now. If it's a success, we'll get it. It'll be a success. We'll get it.
I am glad you will be involved in the writing...
Same here.
I think I just died a little.  That is the best news I have ever heard.  Now how do you keep them from ruining it like Fantastic Four?

It's very exciting! It's been all over teh webz today. One more thing for us to wait for! Don't let 'em screw it up!;)

comments.upictitle: Save the Cheerleader, Save the World: Brothels and Pirates
comments.article:
I agree! This is awesome!


Hi :)
I was so excited when I heard the news. I thought, "If anyone can do this well, it's HBO." Bravo and congratulations! :)

I saw that this afternoon, and I couldn't believe what my eyes were saying: HBO, and A Song of Ice and Fire? Oh, gosh. It's been a long time since I was so excited about a show [not entirely true though: I was very excited with the two episodes show of the Hogfather, but that's it: it was only for two episodes, even if it was GREAT].
HBO is known for the quality of its series. So I have great hopes for a Son of Ice and Fire. I'm pretty sure though that they may have a hard time with some scenes [Arya killing at 9, Dany getting married at 12, etc]. We'll see how they pull that out :)
I can't suscribe to HBO, but I'll be looking towards the serie when it'll come to France [I'm sure it will: it has to; or else, I'll have to pay loads to see the serie in DVD lol].

~Syn

I'm pretty sure though that they may have a hard time with some scenes

Have you seen Deadwood and Rome? Those should put your worries at rest. :)

I'm happy to wait a little while longer for a television adaptation. Firstly it gives me time to brush up on my acting skills ;) Secondly waiting is better than expecting nothing coming at all. Congrats on the big deal!!

DJ
Congratulations!!!  And oh my goodness, I hope they don't break our hearts with this series!

I know the names are too big budget, but a bunch of us over at the Song of Ice and Fire board have been casting the movie/miniseries for awhile now. I made a site to show the ideas we have and I figured it couldn't hurt to link it here. Just in case you wanted to use one of them. :P

http://www.geocities.com/asoiafcasting/

And again, this is awesome news!

That list is fun - lists like that are always kind of silly, but there are a few I'd love to see. The one for Melisandre though... that is freaking hilarious, with the "Complete Moisture Plus" caption.
